title: Beti Bachao Beti Padhao
objective: To promote the education of the girl child and address the issue of declining child sex ratio in India
benefits: Financial incentives for the girl child's education, awareness campaigns to promote gender equality and education of the girl child, and support for the prevention of female foeticide and infanticide
application-procedure: Online or offline application, depending on the specific component of the scheme
documents-required: Proof of identity and residence, birth certificate of the girl child, and income certificate if applicable

title: National Means-cum-Merit Scholarship
objective: To provide financial assistance to meritorious but economically disadvantaged students to continue their secondary education

eligibility.income: Family income should not exceed Rs. 1.50 lakh per annum

benefits: Scholarship amount of Rs. 12,000 per annum, covering all expenses related to secondary education
application-procedure: Online application through the National Scholarship Portal
documents-required: Proof of identity and residence, income certificate, and previous year's marks sheet

title: Pradhan Mantri Vidya Lakshmi Yojana
objective: To provide a single-window platform for students to apply for education loans from various banks in India
benefits: Easy access to education loans from various banks, reduced paperwork and hassle for students, and online tracking of loan applications
application-procedure: Online application through the Vidya Lakshmi portal, followed by submission of documents and verification by the bank
documents-required: Proof of identity and residence, admission letter from the educational institution, income certificate, and other documents as required by the bank

title: Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan
objective: To provide free and compulsory education to all children in the age group of 6-14 years
benefits: Free education, inclusive education for children with special needs, provision for mid-day meals, and support for teacher training and development
application-procedure: Automatic enrolment for children in the target age group, and registration through Common Service Centres (CSCs) for out-of-school children
documents-required: Birth certificate or age proof document, and identification documents such as Aadhaar card or voter ID card

title: National Means-cum-Merit Scholarship Scheme
objective: To provide financial assistance to meritorious students from economically weaker sections to continue their secondary and higher secondary education

eligibility.income: Family income should not exceed Rs. 1.5 lakh per annum

benefits: Scholarship of Rs. 12,000 per annum for meritorious students from economically weaker sections to continue their secondary and higher secondary education
application-procedure: Selection through a written examination conducted by the State education Board, and submission of application through the concerned State/UT education department
documents-required: Income certificate, caste certificate, and identification documents such as Aadhaar card or voter ID card

title: Rashtriya Madhyamik Shiksha Abhiyan
objective: To improve the quality of secondary education and increase access to it in India
benefits: Provision for infrastructure development in schools, teacher training and development, vocational education, and support for inclusive education
application-procedure: Automatic enrolment for students in the target age group, and registration through Common Service Centres (CSCs) for out-of-school children
documents-required: Birth certificate or age proof document, and identification documents such as Aadhaar card or voter ID card

title: Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana
objective: To provide financial protection and access to quality healthcare to the economically disadvantaged sections of society in India

eligibility.income: Family income should not exceed Rs. 5 lakh per annum

benefits: Coverage of up to Rs. 5 lakh per family per annum for secondary and tertiary healthcare services, cashless and paperless access to healthcare services at empanelled hospitals, and provision for pre and post hospitalization expenses
application-procedure: Automatic enrolment for families identified under the Socio-Economic Caste Census (SECC) database or registration through Common Service Centres (CSCs) or Ayushman Bharat - Health and Wellness Centres (AB-HWCs)
documents-required: Identification documents such as Aadhaar card and ration card, and other documents as required for verification of eligibility

title: National Health Protection Scheme
objective: To provide financial protection and access to quality healthcare to the economically disadvantaged sections of society in India

eligibility.income: Family income should not exceed Rs. 5 lakh per annum

benefits: Coverage of up to Rs. 5 lakh per family per annum for secondary and tertiary healthcare services, cashless and paperless access to healthcare services at empanelled hospitals, and provision for pre and post hospitalization expenses
application-procedure: Automatic enrolment for families identified under the Socio-Economic Caste Census (SECC) database or registration through Common Service Centres (CSCs) or Ayushman Bharat - Health and Wellness Centres (AB-HWCs)
documents-required: Identification documents such as Aadhaar card and ration card, and other documents as required for verification of eligibility

title: Swachh Bharat Abhiyan
objective: To promote cleanliness, hygiene and sanitation in India and eliminate open defecation
benefits: Clean and hygienic surroundings, improved health and reduced risk of water-borne diseases, and creation of employment opportunities in the sanitation sector
application-procedure: Participation in the cleanliness drives organised by the government, and adoption of sanitation practices at an individual level
documents-required: None

title: National Rural Health Mission
objective: To provide accessible, affordable and quality healthcare to the rural population of India
benefits: Improved healthcare services in rural areas, provision for community participation and empowerment, and promotion of preventive and promotive healthcare practices
application-procedure: Automatic enrolment for families identified under the Socio-Economic Caste Census (SECC) database or registration through Common Service Centres (CSCs) or Ayushman Bharat - Health and Wellness Centres (AB-HWCs)
documents-required: Identification documents such as Aadhaar card and ration card, and other documents as required for verification of eligibility

title: National Mental Health Programme
objective: To provide accessible, affordable and quality mental healthcare services to the population of India
benefits: Improved mental healthcare services, reduction in stigma associated with mental health issues, and promotion of mental wellness
application-procedure: Registration and consultation at mental health clinics and hospitals, and participation in mental health awareness and education programmes
documents-required: Identification documents such as Aadhaar card and other documents as required for verification of eligibility

title: Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana
objective: To provide financial assistance to pregnant and lactating women for their health and nutrition needs

eligibility.age: Pregnant and lactating women of 19 years of age or above
eligibility.income: Family income should not exceed Rs. 1.5 lakh per annum

benefits: Cash incentive of Rs. 5,000 in three instalments for pregnant and lactating women to meet their health and nutrition needs
application-procedure: Registration at the nearest anganwadi centre or approved health facility
documents-required: Identification documents such as Aadhaar card, bank account details, and pregnancy certificate from a registered medical practitioner

title: Pradhan Mantri Sahaj Bijli Har Ghar Yojana (Saubhagya)
objective: To provide electricity access to all households in India, including those in remote and difficult areas.

eligibility.income: Households with a monthly income of up to Rs. 10,000/-

benefits: Free electricity connection to all households
application-procedure: Online or offline registration through the designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of identity and residence

title: Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Gram Jyoti Yojana (DDUGJY)
objective: To provide uninterrupted electricity supply to rural households, agricultural consumers, and rural industries.

eligibility.income: Households with a monthly income of up to Rs. 10,000/-

benefits: Electricity supply to all rural households, agricultural consumers, and rural industries
application-procedure: Online or offline registration through the designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of identity and residence

title: Ujwal DISCOM Assurance Yojana (UDAY)
objective: To improve the financial and operational performance of state-owned electricity distribution companies (DISCOMs).
benefits: Financial and operational improvement of DISCOMs, leading to better electricity supply to consumers
application-procedure: State government participation through signing of MoU with the Ministry of Power
documents-required: Not applicable

title: Atal Distribution System Improvement Yojana (ADITYA)
objective: To upgrade the power distribution system and reduce losses in urban areas.
benefits: Improved power distribution system in urban areas, resulting in better electricity supply to consumers
application-procedure: State government participation through signing of MoU with the Ministry of Power
documents-required: Not applicable

title: Saubhagya Pradhan Mantri Sahaj Bijli Har Ghar Yojana (Saubhagya) Solar
objective: To provide solar electricity access to all households in remote and difficult areas where grid connectivity is not feasible.

eligibility.income: Households with a monthly income of up to Rs. 10,000/-

benefits: Free solar electricity connection to all households in remote and difficult areas
application-procedure: Online or offline registration through the designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of identity and residence

title: Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Solar Park Yojana (DDUSPY)
objective: To set up solar parks across the country for the generation of solar power.
benefits: Increased generation of solar power, leading to a reduction in carbon emissions and a cleaner environment
application-procedure: State government participation through signing of MoU with the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy
documents-required: Not applicable

title: Swachh Bharat Abhiyan
objective: To achieve a clean and open defecation-free India by 2022.
benefits: Improved cleanliness and hygiene, leading to better health and well-being of citizens
application-procedure: Online or offline registration through the designated authorities
documents-required: Not applicable

title: Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (AMRUT)
objective: To provide basic services like water supply, sewerage, and urban transport to households in urban areas.
benefits: Improved access to basic services in urban areas, leading to better quality of life for citizens
application-procedure: State government participation through signing of MoU with the Ministry of Urban Development
documents-required: Not applicable

title: National Rural Drinking Water Programme (NRDWP)
objective: To provide safe and adequate drinking water to rural households in India.
benefits: Improved access to safe drinking water in rural areas, leading to better health and well-being of citizens
application-procedure: Online or offline registration through the designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of identity and residence

title: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana - Urban (PMAY-U)
objective: To provide affordable housing to the urban poor.

eligibility.income: Economically Weaker Sections (EWS) and Low Income Groups (LIG)

benefits: Affordable housing for urban poor, leading to better quality of life for citizens
application-procedure: Online or offline registration through the designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of identity and residence

title: National Urban Livelihoods Mission (NULM)
objective: To reduce poverty and vulnerability of the urban poor by providing them with employment opportunities and skill development.
benefits: Employment opportunities and skill development for the urban poor, leading to better livelihoods
application-procedure: Online or offline registration through the designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of identity and residence

title: Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (AMRUT) - Sewerage
objective: To provide sewerage connections and treatment plants to households in urban areas.
benefits: Improved access to proper sewerage connections and treatment plants in urban areas, leading to better sanitation and hygiene
application-procedure: State government participation through signing of MoU with the Ministry of Urban Development
documents-required: Not applicable

title: Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana (PMJDY)
objective: To ensure financial inclusion of every citizen of India by providing them access to basic banking services.
benefits: Access to basic banking services like savings account, debit card, and insurance
application-procedure: Online or offline registration through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of identity and residence

title: Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (PMMY)
objective: To provide financial assistance to small and micro enterprises.
benefits: Financial assistance for starting or expanding small and micro enterprises
application-procedure: Online or offline registration through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of identity, residence, and business plan

title: Goods and Services Tax (GST)
objective: To simplify the tax structure in India by introducing a unified tax system.
benefits: Simplification of the tax structure in India, leading to better compliance and easier tax filing for businesses
application-procedure: Online registration through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of identity, PAN card, and business registration

title: Pradhan Mantri Vaya Vandana Yojana (PMVVY)
objective: To provide regular pension income to senior citizens of India.
benefits: Regular pension income for senior citizens, leading to financial security
application-procedure: Online or offline registration through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of age and identity

title: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)
objective: To provide crop insurance to farmers in case of crop loss or damage.

eligibility.income: Farmers with insurable interest in the notified crop

benefits: Crop insurance for farmers in case of crop loss or damage, leading to financial security
application-procedure: Online or offline registration through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of land ownership and crop details

title: Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojana (PMGKY)
objective: To provide a one-time amnesty scheme for tax evaders to declare their undisclosed income and pay tax on it.
benefits: One-time amnesty for tax evaders to declare their undisclosed income and pay tax on it
application-procedure: Online or offline registration through designated authorities
documents-required: Declaration of undisclosed income

title: Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana (PMKVY)
objective: To provide skill training to youth across India, leading to increased employability.
benefits: Skill training and certification, leading to increased employability and better job prospects
application-procedure: Online or offline registration through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of identity and age

title: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA)
objective: To provide employment opportunities to rural households across India.
benefits: Guaranteed employment of up to 100 days per year for rural households, leading to increased income and financial security
application-procedure: Online or offline registration through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of identity and address

title: Stand-Up India Scheme
objective: To provide loans to women and SC/ST entrepreneurs for setting up greenfield enterprises in India.
benefits: Collateral-free loans for setting up greenfield enterprises, leading to increased entrepreneurship and job creation
application-procedure: Online or offline registration through designated authorities
documents-required: Business plan and project report

title: Pradhan Mantri Rojgar Protsahan Yojana (PMRPY)
objective: To incentivize employers for generating new employment opportunities in India.
benefits: Employer contribution to Employees' Pension Scheme (EPS) and Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) for new employees, leading to increased job creation
application-procedure: Online registration through designated authorities
documents-required: EPF and EPS registration details

title: Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana (DDU-GKY)
objective: To provide skill training and employment opportunities to rural youth in India.
benefits: Skill training and placement-linked employment opportunities for rural youth, leading to increased income and financial security
application-procedure: Online or offline registration through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of identity and address

title: Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (PMMY)
objective: To provide collateral-free loans to micro and small enterprises (MSEs) in India.
benefits: Collateral-free loans for starting or expanding micro and small enterprises, leading to increased entrepreneurship and job creation
application-procedure: Online or offline registration through designated authorities
documents-required: Business plan and project report

title: National Legal Services Authority (NALSA) Scheme
objective: To provide legal aid and assistance to marginalized and underprivileged sections of society in India.
benefits: Free legal aid and assistance to marginalized and underprivileged sections of society, leading to increased access to justice
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of identity and income

title: Pradhan Mantri Jan Vikas Karyakram (PMJVK)
objective: To provide infrastructure and basic amenities to minority communities in India.
benefits: Infrastructure development and provision of basic amenities to minority communities, leading to improved living standards and access to justice
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of identity and income

title: Beti Bachao Beti Padhao (BBBP)
objective: To promote gender equality and the education of girl children in India.
benefits: Awareness campaigns and financial incentives for the education and empowerment of girl children, leading to increased gender equality and access to justice
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of identity and education

title: Swachh Bharat Abhiyan
objective: To promote cleanliness and hygiene in India, leading to improved health and sanitation.
benefits: Awareness campaigns, construction of toilets, waste management systems, and other initiatives to promote cleanliness and hygiene, leading to improved health and sanitation
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated authorities
documents-required: Not applicable

title: Saksham Scholarship Scheme
objective: To provide financial assistance to differently-abled students in India for pursuing higher education.
benefits: Financial assistance for tuition fees, books, and other expenses related to higher education for differently-abled students, leading to increased education and employment opportunities
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of disability and income

title: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana
objective: To provide insurance coverage and financial support to farmers in India in the event of crop failure or damage due to natural calamities.
benefits: Insurance coverage and financial support to farmers in the event of crop failure or damage due to natural calamities, leading to increased financial security and reduced agricultural distress
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of ownership of land and crops

title: NALSA Scheme for Legal Aid to the Poor
objective: To provide legal aid and assistance to the poor and marginalized sections of society in India.
benefits: Free legal aid and assistance to the poor and marginalized sections of society in India, leading to increased access to justice and protection of rights
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated legal services authorities
documents-required: Proof of income and residence

title: Grievance Redressal Mechanism for Central Government Employees
objective: To provide a mechanism for central government employees to file and resolve grievances related to their employment.
benefits: A mechanism for central government employees to file and resolve grievances related to their employment, leading to improved working conditions and better employee satisfaction
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated authorities
documents-required: Not applicable

title: NHRC Scheme for Protection of Human Rights Defenders
objective: To provide protection and support to human rights defenders in India who face threats and harassment due to their work.
benefits: Protection and support to human rights defenders in India who face threats and harassment due to their work, leading to increased safety and security for these individuals
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of identity and evidence of threat or harassment

title: POCSO Scheme for Victim Compensation
objective: To provide compensation and support to child victims of sexual offences in India.
benefits: Compensation and support to child victims of sexual offences in India, leading to improved access to justice and protection of rights
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of victimization and medical records

title: NALSA Scheme for Legal Services to Victims of Acid Attack
objective: To provide legal aid and assistance to victims of acid attacks in India.
benefits: Free legal aid and assistance to victims of acid attacks in India, leading to increased access to justice and protection of rights
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated legal services authorities
documents-required: Medical records and proof of victimization

title: CVC Scheme for Whistleblower Protection
objective: To provide protection and support to whistleblowers who report corruption and wrongdoing in public sector organizations in India.
benefits: Protection and support to whistleblowers who report corruption and wrongdoing in public sector organizations in India, leading to improved transparency and accountability
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of identity and evidence of corruption or wrongdoing

title: Startup India Seed Fund Scheme
objective: To provide financial assistance to early-stage startups in India
benefits: Seed funding of up to INR 20 lakhs for eligible startups, leading to increased innovation and entrepreneurship in India
application-procedure: Online application through designated portal
documents-required: Business plan, proof of incorporation, and other relevant documents

title: Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (PMMY) Scheme
objective: To provide financial assistance to micro and small enterprises in India
benefits: Loans of up to INR 10 lakhs for eligible micro and small enterprises, leading to increased self-employment and job creation in India
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated banks or financial institutions
documents-required: Business plan, proof of identity and address, and other relevant documents

title: Stand Up India Scheme
objective: To promote entrepreneurship among women and SC/ST entrepreneurs in India
benefits: Loans of up to INR 1 crore for eligible women and SC/ST entrepreneurs, leading to increased entrepreneurship and job creation in India
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated banks or financial institutions
documents-required: Business plan, proof of identity and address, and other relevant documents

title: Atal Innovation Mission (AIM) Scheme
objective: To promote innovation and entrepreneurship among Indian youth
benefits: Financial assistance and mentorship support for eligible startups, leading to increased innovation and entrepreneurship in India
application-procedure: Online application through designated portal
documents-required: Business plan, proof of identity and address, and other relevant documents

title: National Small Industries Corporation (NSIC) Scheme
objective: To promote the growth of small businesses in India
benefits: Financial and technical support for eligible small businesses, leading to increased growth and competitiveness in India
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated NSIC offices
documents-required: Business plan, proof of identity and address, and other relevant documents

title: Credit Guarantee Fund Trust for Micro and Small Enterprises (CGTMSE) Scheme
objective: To provide collateral-free credit to micro and small enterprises in India
benefits: Collateral-free credit of up to INR 2 crores for eligible micro and small enterprises, leading to increased self-employment and job creation in India
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated banks or financial institutions
documents-required: Business plan, proof of identity and address, and other relevant documents

title: National Social Assistance Programme (NSAP) Scheme
objective: To provide financial assistance to the elderly, widows and disabled people living below the poverty line

eligibility.age: 60 years and above for elderly, 40-59 years for widows, and any age for disabled people

benefits: Financial assistance in the form of monthly pension, leading to improved living standards for eligible beneficiaries
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of age, income, and other relevant documents

title: Pradhan Mantri Vaya Vandana Yojana (PMVVY) Scheme
objective: To provide a pension income to senior citizens of India
benefits: Guaranteed pension income of up to INR 10,000 per month for eligible senior citizens, leading to financial security and stability
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of age, address, and other relevant documents

title: Atal Pension Yojana (APY) Scheme
objective: To provide a pension income to workers in the unorganized sector of India
benefits: Guaranteed pension income of up to INR 5,000 per month for eligible workers in the unorganized sector, leading to financial security and stability
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of age, address, and other relevant documents

title: National Pension System (NPS) Scheme
objective: To provide retirement income to individuals in the organized and unorganized sectors of India
benefits: Flexible retirement income options for eligible individuals, with the option to choose investment strategy and pension fund manager
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of age, address, and other relevant documents

title: Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana (PMMVY) Scheme
objective: To provide financial assistance to pregnant and lactating mothers for their first child
benefits: Financial assistance of INR 5,000 in three installments for eligible pregnant and lactating mothers, leading to improved maternal and child health
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of age, address, and other relevant documents

title: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maan-Dhan Yojana (PM-KMY) Scheme
objective: To provide a pension income to small and marginal farmers of India
benefits: Guaranteed pension income of INR 3,000 per month for eligible small and marginal farmers, leading to financial security and stability
application-procedure: Online or offline application through designated authorities
documents-required: Proof of age, address, and other relevant documents

title: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana
objective: To provide insurance coverage and financial support to farmers in case of failure of any notified crop due to natural calamities, pests & diseases.
benefits: Financial support to farmers in case of crop failure due to natural calamities, pests & diseases.
application-procedure: Application can be done through the concerned state's Agriculture Department or through a Common Service Center (CSC) or online at the official PMFBY website.
documents-required: Identity proof, land ownership proof, crop details

title: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojana
objective: To promote water conservation and efficient use of water resources in agriculture through the development of irrigation infrastructure and other water management practices.
benefits: Improvement in irrigation facilities, increase in crop yield and income of farmers.
application-procedure: Application can be done through the concerned state's Agriculture Department.
documents-required: Identity proof, land ownership proof, and other documents related to the project for which the farmer is applying for assistance.

title: Paramparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana
objective: To promote organic farming among farmers and enhance soil fertility, reduce the use of chemicals in agriculture, and provide a premium price to farmers for their organic produce.
benefits: Assistance in the form of training, financial support, and marketing assistance to farmers for adopting organic farming practices.
application-procedure: Application can be done through the concerned state's Agriculture Department.
documents-required: Identity proof, land ownership proof, and other documents related to organic farming certification and marketing assistance.

title: Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana
objective: To provide all-weather road connectivity to unconnected rural habitations in India.
benefits: Improvement in rural connectivity, reduction in travel time and cost, increase in economic activities, and social development.
application-procedure: Application can be done through the concerned state's Rural Development Department.
documents-required: Proof of residence, land ownership proof, and other documents related to the project for which the applicant is applying for assistance.

title: Swachh Bharat Abhiyan
objective: To make India clean and free from open defecation, littering, and pollution.
benefits: Improvement in public health, cleanliness and hygiene, and environmental conservation.
application-procedure: Citizens can participate in the program voluntarily, and local authorities can apply for funding and support.
documents-required: No specific documents required for participation, but local authorities may need to provide project details and financial estimates for funding support.

title: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana
objective: To provide insurance coverage and financial assistance to farmers in case of crop loss or damage due to natural calamities, pests, or diseases.

eligibility.income: Farmers with insurable interest in the crop

benefits: Financial assistance and insurance coverage to farmers for crop loss or damage.
application-procedure: Farmers can apply for the scheme through their respective State Agricultural Departments or through designated insurance companies.
documents-required: Documents related to the crop and its cultivation, proof of land ownership or tenancy, and other relevant documents as required by the respective State Agricultural Department.

title: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojana
objective: To improve irrigation facilities and water management practices in agriculture, increase crop productivity, and promote sustainable agriculture practices.
benefits: Improved irrigation facilities, increased crop productivity, and promotion of sustainable agriculture practices.
application-procedure: Application can be done through the concerned state's Agriculture Department.
documents-required: Proof of land ownership or tenancy, and other relevant documents as required by the respective State Agriculture Department.
